body:
Hi!
They dont use github. You might make a issue and put uor patch at Jira. 
Here it is.

https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CONNECTORS/
s/uor/your/g

> On Feb 8, 2015, at 12:43 AM, Kishore Kumar notifications@github.com wrote:
> 
> Hi @kwright
> There was a bug in this file since version 1.8, when we try to add a Livelink folder in Path tab, it was breaking and today I found that this was because, you missed seqPrefix+ in line no 3265, Please consider changing this in the next release.
> Now since, I became more familiar with ManifoldCF architecture, I may be try to find more bug in livelink connector here on.
> 
> Thanks for such a great tool to index.
> 
> You can view, comment on, or merge this pull request online at:
> 
>   https://github.com/apache/manifoldcf/pull/3
> 
> Commit Summary
> 
>   • Update LivelinkConnector.java
> File Changes
> 
>   • M connectors/livelink/connector/src/main/java/org/apache/manifoldcf/crawler/connectors/livelink/LivelinkConnector.java (2)
> Patch Links:
> 
>   • https://github.com/apache/manifoldcf/pull/3.patch
>   • https://github.com/apache/manifoldcf/pull/3.diff
> —
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub.

Hello Kishar,

I looked at the link and the code was written by Karl Wright and not me. Sorry I couldn't help you.

--Kevin

Thanks @yoshi0309

I submitted a issue with JIRA.

@kwright 

No problem, I submitted via JIRA and was accepted by ManifodCF Team.
Hello……I terminated the translation

Thanks @gladyscarrizales for the Spanish translation!
For your future contributions, can you please mention the JIRA issue (e.g. `CONNECTORS-1256`) in the pull request title? We would like to test whether this action will link jira issue and the pull request. 

Can you please close this pull request, if you feel like your present contribution is successfully propagated/reflected into the ManifoldCF source tree.
Thanks!
hi iorixxx, can be useful keep it opened so I can update the translation for future works, what do you think?
Given that https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CONNECTORS-1256 is closed as resolved, future works  would be better handled in a new pull request (PR) / JIRA ticket.
Please see https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CONNECTORS-1258 for an example, where translation is being updated.
Hi Chalitha, could you please rename the folder name of the connector from mcf-opennlp-connector to just opennlp?

Hi Dileepa, 

The packages structure must follows Apache rules. You can check any other connector currently in the project to see how they must be organized. Please, fix this and commit the changes

Thanks!

Hi Rafa,

I have renamed the packages accordingly. Please review and let me know if it needs any more changes.

Thanks,
Dileepa
Pull requests not consider this, because I sent the trunk branch in place of the spanish branch by mistake.
Can you please close this pull request since [CONNECTORS-1189](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CONNECTORS-1189) is resolved?

Alle commits in including 1915aa40e2e7676c391e62d44b12e06547df5c7b where committed to manifoldcf svn. i close the pull request and will open a rebased pull request for ad811456a73fc0c29c48f6bb0a9c4e9c976fb695 and 7b29251f0d6e99b22db4f12fc980178fb6d706bc
Committed with 0475babfad72f2c6cd4698c612534bb596fbdcf3
committed to svn with 43d20c06c65a55e31d24b1e72897326a332eeb3e and ae02b2fca3ddcedc7caaae040f9ccb81360bdc29 and

I think everything got addressed  in trunk.
Can you please close this PR?

maven build in travis failing due to tika appearing to use the wrong commons-io jar - not sure if this is somehow related to the PR change

Introducing a single dependency change for the alfresco connector in a pom is insufficient to address this issue, since Maven is not the primary build platform for ManifoldCF - ant is.  You will need to address this change in build.xml and the root pom, if indeed common-beans is included there (it may not be).

Github is a mirror of the main svn repository for manifoldcf also, but I can extract a patch from it.
https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CONNECTORS-1714 is resolved

Testing.

Hello.

How do you deal with errors like this?
It seems they are not related with the changes introduced by the PR.

Do I need to do anything more to have this PR evaluated and accepted?

This pull request was merged on Sep 6, 2014 and it is included starting from ManifoldCF 1.7.1:
https://github.com/apache/manifoldcf/commit/64cc9f5daead7d890952d4bb258d6060c557b5e2

This pull request is currently included for a long time starting from ManifoldCF 2.3:
https://github.com/apache/manifoldcf/blob/trunk/CHANGES.txt#L947

This pull request was merged in ManifoldCF 2.6:
https://github.com/apache/manifoldcf/blob/trunk/CHANGES.txt#L898

This pull request was refused because Apache Stanbol moved into the Attic in April 2020:
https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CONNECTORS-1181

This pull request was merged in ManifoldCF 2.14:
https://github.com/apache/manifoldcf/blob/trunk/CHANGES.txt#L220

This pull request was merged in ManifoldCF 2.16:
https://github.com/apache/manifoldcf/blob/trunk/CHANGES.txt#L190
This pull request is including something included in the default project so we don't want to merge it

This pull request was merged in ManifoldCF 2.22.1:
https://github.com/apache/manifoldcf/blob/trunk/CHANGES.txt#L68

Hi Douglas,
Thank you so much for this commit update but for the next release 2.27 we don't want to change any specific part of the code related to logic or connectors because we are recreating the entire release process from scratch.

Anyway part of your initial changes were included in ManifoldCF 2.12 and 2.23. I see that only the last commit is updating the Google Drive dependencies. 

We could evaluate this for ManifoldCF 2.28 so we have to hold on for this latest upgrade for the Google Drive Connector.
I created a specific ticket for this:
https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CONNECTORS-1758

This pull request was merged in ManifoldCF 2.25:
https://github.com/apache/manifoldcf/blob/trunk/CHANGES.txt#L37

This pull request was merged in ManifoldCF 2.26:
https://github.com/apache/manifoldcf/blob/trunk/CHANGES.txt#L24

Thank you so much Mingchun for this contribution,
we will work on merging this pull request after releasing ManifoldCF 2.27 due to the drastic change we are doing for the entire release process because we don't want to change connectors.

So we will apply this change for ManifoldCF 2.28.

Thank you @guylaine-bassette for your contribution, we will consider this for ManifoldCF 2.28 because we don't want to apply any changes to the base code for 2.27 release, this due to the drastic change in the release process.

I have just created a ticket for this:
https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CONNECTORS-1759

Thank you @guylaine-bassette for your contribution, we will consider this for ManifoldCF 2.28 because we don't want to apply any changes to the base code for 2.27 release, this due to the drastic change in the release process.

I have just created another ticket for this:
https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CONNECTORS-1760

I have just created another ticket for this:
https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CONNECTORS-1762

I ran all the tests and it worked correctly, just merged in the trunk.
Thank you so much for your contribution @Soggard !
I ran all the tests and it works, I'm going to merge this in the trunk

I ran all the tests and played a little bit with it, I'm going to merge this on the trunk.
@guylaine-bassette thank you again for your contribution!
Merged in the trunk, thank you so much for your contribution @douglascrp ! 😄

I had to revert all the commits of this pull request because it brakes the Ant build.
Probably because in the trunk now we have different dependencies for the vulnerability fix merged before. 
@douglascrp could you please try to rework a little bit this contribution in order to be compliant with the current trunk?

I think that there is a problem with some dependencies of the Google Drive API v3.
Thank you so much for your contribution!
I'm sorry maybe I found an issue with the HSQL db dependencies, please don't invest time to rework your contribution because the issue depends on another pull request. I'll let you know the result.
Resolved the dependency conflict related to HSQLDB and now I'm working on remerging again this contribution
